com.mesosphere.sdk.state

Interface StateStore

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CuratorStateStore, StateStoreCache

    public interface StateStore
    A StateStore stores the state of the frameworks, including tasks' TaskInfo and TaskStatus objects. Each distinct Task is expected to have a unique Task Name, determined by the framework developer.

    TaskInfo objects should be persisted when a Task is launched or when reserved resources associated with a potential future Task launch should be recorded.

    TaskStatus is reported by Mesos to Frameworks at various points including at Task Reconciliation and when Tasks change state. The TaskStatus of a Task should be recorded so that the state of a Framework's Tasks can be queried.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearAllData()
      Clears the root service node, leaving just the root node behind.
      void clearFrameworkId()
      Removes any previously stored FrameworkID or does nothing if no FrameworkID was previously stored.
      void clearProperty(java.lang.String key)
      Clears a given property from the StateStore, or does nothing if no such property exists.
      void clearTask(java.lang.String taskName)
      Removes all data associated with a particular Task including any stored TaskInfo and/or TaskStatus.
      java.util.Optional<Protos.FrameworkID> fetchFrameworkId()
      Fetches the previously stored FrameworkID, or returns an empty Optional if no FrameworkId was previously stored.
      byte[] fetchProperty(java.lang.String key)
      Fetches the value byte array, stored against the Property key, or throws an error if no matching key is found.
      java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> fetchPropertyKeys()
      Fetches the list of Property keys, or an empty list if none are found.
      java.util.Optional<TaskStatus> fetchStatus(java.lang.String taskName)
      Fetches the TaskStatus for a particular Task, or returns an empty Optional if no matching status is found.

      Fetches all TaskStatuses from the underlying storage, or an empty list if none are found.

      Fetches the TaskInfo for a particular Task, or returns an empty Optional if no matching task is found.

      Fetches all the Task names listed in the underlying storage.

      Stores the FrameworkID for a framework so on Scheduler restart re-registration may occur.

      Stores the TaskStatus of a particular Task.

    • Method Detail

      • storeFrameworkId

        void storeFrameworkId(Protos.FrameworkID fwkId)
               throws StateStoreException
        Stores the FrameworkID for a framework so on Scheduler restart re-registration may occur.
        Parameters:
        fwkId - FrameworkID to be store
        Throws:
        StateStoreException - when storing the FrameworkID fails

      • clearFrameworkId

        void clearFrameworkId()
               throws StateStoreException
        Removes any previously stored FrameworkID or does nothing if no FrameworkID was previously stored.
        Throws:
        StateStoreException - when clearing a FrameworkID fails

      • fetchFrameworkId

        java.util.Optional<Protos.FrameworkID> fetchFrameworkId()
                                                 throws StateStoreException
        Fetches the previously stored FrameworkID, or returns an empty Optional if no FrameworkId was previously stored.
        Returns:
        The previously stored FrameworkID, or an empty Optional indicating the FrameworkID has not been set.
        Throws:
        StateStoreException - when fetching the FrameworkID fails

      • storeTasks

        void storeTasks(java.util.Collection<TaskInfo> tasks)
         throws StateStoreException
        Stores TaskInfo objects representing tasks which are desired by the framework. This must be called before storeStatus(TaskStatus) for any given task id, and it must behave as an atomic transaction: On success, everything is written, while on failure nothing is written.
        Parameters:
        tasks - Tasks to be stored, which each meet the above requirements
        Throws:
        StateStoreException - when persisting TaskInfo information fails, or if its TaskId is malformed

      • storeStatus

        void storeStatus(TaskStatus status)
          throws StateStoreException
        Stores the TaskStatus of a particular Task. The TaskInfo for this exact task MUST have already been written via storeTasks(Collection) beforehand. The TaskId must be well-formatted as produced by CommonIdUtils.toTaskId(String).
        Parameters:
        status - The status to be stored, which meets the above requirements
        Throws:
        StateStoreException - if storing the TaskStatus fails, or if its TaskId is malformed, or if its matching TaskInfo wasn't stored first

      • clearTask

        void clearTask(java.lang.String taskName)
        throws StateStoreException
        Removes all data associated with a particular Task including any stored TaskInfo and/or TaskStatus.
        Parameters:
        taskName - The name of the task to be cleared
        Throws:
        StateStoreException - when clearing the indicated Task's information fails

      • fetchTaskNames

        java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> fetchTaskNames()
                                               throws StateStoreException
        Fetches all the Task names listed in the underlying storage. Note that these should always have a TaskInfo, but may lack TaskStatus.
        Returns:
        All the Task names stored so far, or an empty list if none are found
        Throws:
        StateStoreException - when fetching the data fails

      • fetchTasks

        java.util.Collection<TaskInfo> fetchTasks()
                                   throws StateStoreException
        Fetches and returns all TaskInfos from the underlying storage, or an empty list if none are found. This list should be a superset of the list returned by fetchStatuses().
        Returns:
        All TaskInfos
        Throws:
        StateStoreException - if fetching the TaskInfo information otherwise fails

      • fetchTask

        java.util.Optional<TaskInfo> fetchTask(java.lang.String taskName)
                                throws StateStoreException
        Fetches the TaskInfo for a particular Task, or returns an empty Optional if no matching task is found.
        Parameters:
        taskName - The name of the Task
        Returns:
        The corresponding TaskInfo object
        Throws:
        StateStoreException - if no data was found for the requested name, or if fetching the TaskInfo otherwise fails

      • fetchStatuses

        java.util.Collection<TaskStatus> fetchStatuses()
                                        throws StateStoreException
        Fetches all TaskStatuses from the underlying storage, or an empty list if none are found. Note that this list may have fewer entries than fetchTasks() if some tasks are lacking statuses.
        Returns:
        The TaskStatus objects associated with all tasks
        Throws:
        StateStoreException - if fetching the TaskStatus information fails

      • fetchStatus

        java.util.Optional<TaskStatus> fetchStatus(java.lang.String taskName)
                                    throws StateStoreException
        Fetches the TaskStatus for a particular Task, or returns an empty Optional if no matching status is found. A given task may sometimes have TaskInfo while lacking TaskStatus.
        Parameters:
        taskName - The name of the Task which should have its status retrieved
        Returns:
        The TaskStatus associated with a particular Task
        Throws:
        StateStoreException - if no data was found for the requested name, or if fetching the TaskStatus information otherwise fails

      • storeProperty

        void storeProperty(java.lang.String key,
                   byte[] value)
            throws StateStoreException
        Stores an arbitrary key/value pair.
        Parameters:
        key - must be a non-blank String without any forward slashes ('/')
        value - The value should be a byte array no larger than 1MB (1024 * 1024 bytes)
        Throws:
        StateStoreException - if the key or value fail validation, or if storing the data otherwise fails
        See Also:
        StateStoreUtils.validateKey(String), StateStoreUtils.validateValue(byte[])

      • fetchProperty

        byte[] fetchProperty(java.lang.String key)
              throws StateStoreException
        Fetches the value byte array, stored against the Property key, or throws an error if no matching key is found.
        Parameters:
        key - must be a non-blank String without any forward slashes ('/')
        Throws:
        StateStoreException - if no data was found for the requested key, or if fetching the data otherwise fails
        See Also:
        StateStoreUtils.validateKey(String)

      • fetchPropertyKeys

        java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> fetchPropertyKeys()
                                                  throws StateStoreException
        Fetches the list of Property keys, or an empty list if none are found.
        Throws:
        StateStoreException - if fetching the list otherwise fails

      • clearProperty

        void clearProperty(java.lang.String key)
            throws StateStoreException
        Clears a given property from the StateStore, or does nothing if no such property exists.
        Parameters:
        key - must be a non-blank String without any forward slashes ('/')
        Throws:
        StateStoreException - if key validation fails or clearing the entry fails

      • clearAllData

        void clearAllData()
           throws StateStoreException
        Clears the root service node, leaving just the root node behind.
        Throws:
        StateStoreException
